nodes.name: Geography
nodes.description: Curriculum for K-12 Geography in the United States, covering spatial thinking, places and regions, physical systems, human systems, and environment-society interactions.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Kindergarten Geography
nodes.description: Introduction to geography, focusing on maps, personal location, and the immediate environment.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Identify a map and a globe as representations of Earth.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Describe the location of self and objects in the classroom.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 1 Geography
nodes.description: Focus on the geography of the local community.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Create and use simple maps of the classroom and school.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Identify natural and human-made features in the community.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 2 Geography
nodes.description: Expanding to understand continents, oceans, and different environments.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Locate and name the seven continents and five oceans.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Compare different kinds of communities (urban, suburban, rural).
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 3 Geography
nodes.description: Focus on the geography of the local state and region.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Use maps to identify major cities, rivers, and landforms in their state.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Explain how the environment affects human activity in their region.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 4 Geography
nodes.description: Study of the physical and human geography of the different regions of the United States.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Locate the major regions of the United States and identify their states.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Compare the climate, landforms, and natural resources of different U.S. regions.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 5 Geography
nodes.description: Focus on the geography of the United States in relation to the Western Hemisphere.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Use latitude and longitude to locate places in the Western Hemisphere.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Describe major patterns of human settlement in the Americas.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: History
nodes.description: Curriculum for K-12 History in the United States, covering American history, world history, civics, and cultural understanding.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Kindergarten History
nodes.description: Introduction to history focusing on personal identity, family, and community.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Describe personal characteristics and family traditions.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Identify how we learn about the past through family stories and photographs.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 1 History
nodes.description: Focus on family history, school traditions, and community helpers.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 2 History
nodes.description: Introduction to community history and American symbols.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 3 History
nodes.description: Focus on local history, Native American cultures, and early explorers.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Compare and contrast different Native American cultural groups.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Describe how Native Americans adapted to their environments.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 4 History
nodes.description: Study of state history, including settlement, development, and key historical figures.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Grade 5 History
nodes.description: Focus on early American history including exploration, colonization, and the Revolutionary War.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Describe the reasons for European exploration and colonization of North America.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.name: Compare the different colonial regions and their characteristics.
nodes.subject: Social Studies

nodes.description: Foundational math skills for kindergarten students

nodes.description: Know number names and the count sequence

nodes.name: Count to 100 by ones and by tens
nodes.description: Count to 100 by ones and by tens

nodes.name: Count forward beginning from a given number
nodes.description: Count forward beginning from a given number within the known sequence

nodes.name: Grade 1 Mathematics
nodes.description: First grade mathematics curriculum
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
nodes.description: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Use addition and subtraction within 20
nodes.description: Use addition and subtraction within 20 to solve word problems
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Grade 2 Mathematics
nodes.description: Second grade mathematics curriculum
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
nodes.description: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Use addition and subtraction within 100
nodes.description: Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve one- and two-step word problems
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Grade 3 Mathematics
nodes.description: Third grade mathematics curriculum
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
nodes.description: Represent and solve problems involving multiplication and division
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Interpret products of whole numbers
nodes.description: Interpret products of whole numbers as equal groups
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Interpret whole-number quotients
nodes.description: Interpret whole-number quotients of whole numbers
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Number and Operations—Fractions
nodes.description: Develop understanding of fractions as numbers
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Understand a fraction as a number
nodes.description: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Grade 4 Mathematics
nodes.description: Fourth grade mathematics curriculum
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
nodes.description: Use the four operations with whole numbers to solve problems
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Interpret multiplication equations as comparisons
nodes.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Number and Operations—Fractions
nodes.description: Extend understanding of fraction equivalence and ordering
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Explain why fractions are equivalent
nodes.description: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n×a)/(n×b)
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Grade 5 Mathematics
nodes.description: Fifth grade mathematics curriculum
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Operations and Algebraic Thinking
nodes.description: Write and interpret numerical expressions
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Use parentheses and brackets in expressions
nodes.description: Use parentheses, brackets, or braces in numerical expressions
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Number and Operations—Fractions
nodes.description: Use equivalent fractions as a strategy to add and subtract fractions
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators
nodes.description: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators by replacing given fractions with equivalent fractions
nodes.subject: Mathematics

nodes.name: Physical Education
nodes.description: Curriculum for K-12 Physical Education in the United States, focusing on motor skills, health-related fitness, and personal and social responsibility.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Kindergarten Physical Education
nodes.description: Introduction to basic motor skills, movement concepts, and cooperative play.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Demonstrate basic locomotor skills (running, jumping, hopping).
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Grade 1 Physical Education
nodes.description: Refining locomotor skills and introducing object control.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Toss and catch a large ball with two hands.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Grade 2 Physical Education
nodes.description: Combining motor skills and applying them in simple games.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Identify activities that increase heart rate.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Grade 3 Physical Education
nodes.description: Focus on cooperative games and applying skills with partners.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Work cooperatively with a partner or small group.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Grade 4 Physical Education
nodes.description: Introduction to fitness concepts and simple game tactics.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Describe the components of fitness (cardio, strength, flexibility).
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Grade 5 Physical Education
nodes.description: Applying skills to modified sports and lifetime activities.
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: Demonstrate mature form for skills in a modified sport (e.g., dribbling in basketball).
nodes.subject: Physical Education

nodes.name: United States
nodes.description: United States K-12 education system

nodes.name: Science
nodes.description: Curriculum for K-12 Science in the United States, based on the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS).
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Kindergarten Science
nodes.description: Introduction to scientific concepts for Kindergarten, focusing on forces, organisms, and weather.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Physical Sciences (PS)
nodes.description: Motion and Stability: Forces and Interactions.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Life Sciences (LS)
nodes.description: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Earth and Space Sciences (ESS)
nodes.description: Earth's Systems and Earth and Human Activity.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Plan and conduct an investigation to compare the effects of pushes and pulls on the motion of an object. (K-PS2-1)
nodes.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to compare the effects of different strengths or different directions of pushes and pulls on the motion of an object.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Use observations to describe patterns of what plants and animals need to survive. (K-LS1-1)
nodes.description: Use observations to describe patterns of what plants and animals (including humans) need to survive.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Use and share observations of local weather conditions to describe patterns over time. (K-ESS2-1)
nodes.description: Use and share observations of local weather conditions to describe patterns over time.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Communicate solutions that will reduce the impact of humans on the local environment. (K-ESS3-3)
nodes.description: Communicate solutions that will reduce the impact of humans on the land, water, air, and/or other living things in the local environment.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Grade 1 Science
nodes.description: Exploring waves, structures and functions of organisms, and space systems for Grade 1.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Physical Sciences (PS)
nodes.description: Waves and Their Applications in Technologies for Information Transfer.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Life Sciences (LS)
nodes.description: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes; Heredity: Inheritance and Variation of Traits.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Earth and Space Sciences (ESS)
nodes.description: Earth's Place in the Universe.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Plan and conduct investigations about sound and vibrating materials. (1-PS4-1)
nodes.description: Plan and conduct investigations to provide evidence that vibrating materials can make sound and that sound can make materials vibrate.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts. (1-LS1-1)
nodes.description: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts to help them survive, grow, and meet their needs.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Use observations of the sun, moon, and stars to describe patterns that can be predicted. (1-ESS1-1)
nodes.description: Use observations of the sun, moon, and stars to describe patterns that can be predicted.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Grade 2 Science
nodes.description: Investigating properties of matter, ecosystems, and Earth's systems for Grade 2.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Physical Sciences (PS)
nodes.description: Structure and Properties of Matter.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Life Sciences (LS)
nodes.description: Ecosystems: Interactions, Energy, and Dynamics.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Earth and Space Sciences (ESS)
nodes.description: Earth's Systems: Processes that Shape the Earth.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties. (2-PS1-1)
nodes.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Develop a simple model that mimics the function of an animal in dispersing seeds or pollinating plants. (2-LS2-2)
nodes.description: Develop a simple model that mimics the function of an animal in dispersing seeds or pollinating plants.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Compare multiple solutions designed to slow or prevent wind or water from changing the shape of the land. (2-ESS2-1)
nodes.description: Compare multiple solutions designed to slow or prevent wind or water from changing the shape of the land.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Grade 3 Science
nodes.description: Investigating forces, life cycles, ecosystems, and weather for Grade 3.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Plan and conduct an investigation to provide evidence of the effects of balanced and unbalanced forces on the motion of an object. (3-PS2-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Develop models to describe that organisms have unique and diverse life cycles but all have in common birth, growth, reproduction, and death. (3-LS1-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Represent data in tables and graphical displays to describe typical weather conditions expected in a particular season. (3-ESS2-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Grade 4 Science
nodes.description: Exploring energy, waves, organism structures, and Earth processes for Grade 4.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Use evidence to construct an explanation relating the speed of an object to the energy of that object. (4-PS3-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Construct an argument that plants and animals have internal and external structures that function to support survival, growth, behavior, and reproduction. (4-LS1-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Identify evidence from patterns in rock formations and fossils in rock layers to explain changes in a landscape over time. (4-ESS1-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Grade 5 Science
nodes.description: Investigating matter, energy flow in ecosystems, and Earth's systems for Grade 5.
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Develop a model to describe that matter is made of particles too small to be seen. (5-PS1-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Develop a model to describe the movement of matter among plants, animals, decomposers, and the environment. (5-LS2-1)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: Represent data in graphical displays to reveal patterns of daily changes in length and direction of shadows, day and night, and the seasonal appearance of some stars in the night sky. (5-ESS1-2)
nodes.subject: Science

nodes.name: World Languages: Spanish
nodes.description: Curriculum for K-12 Spanish as a World Language in the United States, focusing on the 5 C's: Communication, Cultures, Connections, Comparisons, and Communities.
nodes.subject: World Languages

nodes.name: K-2 Spanish (Novice-Low)
nodes.description: Introduction to Spanish for early elementary, focusing on basic vocabulary, greetings, and cultural awareness.
nodes.subject: World Languages

nodes.name: Identify some products and practices of Spanish-speaking cultures (e.g., foods, holidays).
nodes.subject: World Languages

nodes.name: Grades 3-5 Spanish (Novice-Mid)
nodes.description: Building on foundations with more complex sentences, questions, and cultural comparisons.
nodes.subject: World Languages

nodes.name: Ask and answer simple questions about self and family.
nodes.subject: World Languages

nodes.name: Connect Spanish vocabulary to other subjects (e.g., numbers in Math, animals in Science).
nodes.subject: World Languages

nodes.name: Compare patterns of politeness between own culture and Spanish-speaking cultures.
nodes.subject: World Languages
